DOC.brief_summary: Slipped disc is the rupture of the fibrous ring, with subsequent displacement of the nucleus pulposus in intervertebral spaces, which may cause compression of nerve structures. It is estimated that 2-3% of the population have taken with this process, whose prevalence is 4.8% in men and 2.5% in women over 35 years. Thus, the purpose of this study is to verify the effectiveness of global postural reeducation in patients diagnosed with chronic symptomatic lumbar disc herniation with the application of a randomized controlled trial. Will be measured pain, disability and functional flexibility.
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness of Global Postural Reeducation in Patients With Chronic Symptomatic Lumbar Disc Herniation
DOC.criteria: Patients diagnosed with chronic symptomatic lumbar disc herniation Patients who work with severe overloading of the spine, patients with central neurological pathology, wheelchair users, patients who use bracing and support those who submit two consecutive absences to the treatment
